head.title: Jeb Bush's Role In the Everglades

hedline.hl1: Jeb Bush's Role In the Everglades

abstract.p: Alan Farago letter responds to July 13 editorial on Florida Everglades; opposes plans to turn Homestead Air Force Base into commercial airport (M)

block.p: At the same time that Congress and the Clinton administration are moving toward an $8 billion investment to restore the treasured Everglades (editorial, July 13), local politicians are trying to get permits for a multi-billion-dollar commercial airport a few miles from the Everglades, ostensibly to relieve traffic at Miami International Airport.

The majority of local residents do not want a commercial airport in their midst, but this makes no difference to the few who stand to gain if Homestead Air Force Base is turned into a commercial airport, with more than 230,000 flights a year.

At the same time that Congress and the Clinton administration are moving toward an $8 billion investment to restore the treasured Everglades (editorial, July 13), local politicians are trying to get permits for a multi-billion-dollar commercial airport a few miles from the Everglades, ostensibly to relieve traffic at Miami International Airport.

The majority of local residents do not want a commercial airport in their midst, but this makes no difference to the few who stand to gain if Homestead Air Force Base is turned into a commercial airport, with more than 230,000 flights a year.

The investment in a major airport would be a head-on crash with the public interest in restoring degraded ecosystems. The federal government must deal with Homestead Air Force Base responsibly and not let private interests strip away the value of everything we imagined could be saved. ALAN FARAGO Coral Gables, Fla., July 13, 2000
The writer is president of the Everglades Defense Council.
